fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Within kanban board, between the search box and the filters I see list of users. some of them are deleted from our Jira already but still grabs place. including 'Former users'

 Former users are displayed on quick filters on kanban board even after removing them from systems.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 Deleted former users from systems and the issue still remains the same.
h3. Expected Results

Former users are not supposed to get displayed on quick filters in kanban board.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Former users are displayed on quick filter on kanban board.{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Former users are displayed on quick filters on kanban board even after removing them from systems.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating an issue inside a sprint using the inline create issue causes the issue to go to the backlog if there are 2 Sprint fields on Custom Fields page

h3. Environment
Happening for any Cloud Classic Project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new field name Sprint, like the existing one on Jira
# Go to the board backlog and create a new sprint
# Using the inline create issue, try to create a new issue inside the sprint
# The issue will be redirected to the backlog

Video reproducing the issue: https://cl.ly/a16f2f8f084f

h3. Expected Results
Jira should look to the Jira default field and apply the Sprint value to the issue created and set the issue inside the Sprint.

h3. Actual Results
Jira does not know which field is the correct causing the issue to be redirected to the backlog

h3. Workaround
Go to the Custom Fields page and search by Sprints.
One field will be locked (Jira default field), the other is a field manually created.
Rename the field that is not locked.
fields.summary: Creating an issue inside a sprint using the inline create issue causes the issue to go to the backlog if there are 2 Sprint fields

fields.description:
Would be nice to have the ability to add multiple done columns to better reflect status in burnup/burndown charts.

Similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-12169, but within next-gen.
fields.summary: Allow multiple "Done" columns in next-gen boards

fields.description:
when click 'release' button - get some error in console and nothing happens

!image-2019-07-10-18-25-42-502.png|width=796,height=389!
fields.summary: release button doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sprints found belonging to Next-gen Projects cannot be renamed, when attempting to do so you receive an error and the changes are not saved.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to your Next-gen Backlog and go to *Edit sprint* on any active Sprint
# Change the *Sprint name* then *Update* to save

h3. Expected Results

The Sprint should now have a new name from the changes you just did.

h3. Actual Results

The changes are not saved and you get an error saying *Something's gone wrong*.

 !NEXT_GEN_FEATURE_FLAG_-_Agile_board_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Backend stacktrace errors:

{code}
message:	 {"message":"Unrecognized field \"boardId\" (Class com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.sprint.model.UpdateSprintRequest), not marked as ignorable\n at [Source: org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteInputStream@5240fb29; line: 1, column: 49] (through reference chain: com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.sprint.model.UpdateSprintRequest[\"boardId\"])","status-code":500,"stack-trace":"org.codehaus.jackson.map.exc.UnrecognizedPropertyException: Unrecognized field \"boardId\" (Class com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.sprint.model.UpdateSprintRequest), not marked as ignorable\n at [Source: org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteInputStream@5240fb29; line: 1, column: 49] (through reference chain: com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.sprint.model.UpdateSprintRequest[\"boardId\"])\n\tat org.codehaus.jackson.map.exc.UnrecognizedPropertyException.from(UnrecognizedPropertyException.java:53)\n\tat org.codehaus.jackson.map.deser.StdDeserializationContext.unknownFieldException(StdDeserializationContext.java:267)\n\tat org.codehaus.jackson.map.deser.std.StdDeserializer.reportUnknownProperty(StdDeserializer.java:673)\n\tat org.codehaus.jackson.map.deser.std.StdDeserializer.handleUnknownProperty(StdDeserializer.java:659)\n\tat org.codehaus.jackson.map.deser.BeanDeserializer.handleUnknownProperty(BeanDeserializer.java:1365)\n\tat org.codehaus.jackson.map.deser.BeanDeserializer._handleUnknown(BeanDeserializer.java:725)\n\tat org.codehaus.jackson.map.deser.BeanDeserializer.deserializeFromObject(BeanDeserializer.java:703)\n\tat
...
{code}

h3. Workaround

# To change the Sprint name, you must share the Sprint with another Classic Project which would allow you to modify the name from with the Classic Board. This can be done by editing the *Sprint* field from an Issue of a Classic Project and adding it to the Sprint in question.
# The Sprint name can also be updated via API by making a *PUT* call to the [{{/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/(sprintid)}}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-rest-agile-1-0-sprint-sprintId-put] endpoint.
fields.summary: Can't rename Sprints in Next-gen Projects

fields.description:
Currently, changing the "Group by" setting on a next-gen board changes the view for all board viewers of that project.

It would be nice if this were configurable & saved at a user level so changing the board view doesn't change it for all members.
fields.summary: Individual setting for "Group by" on next-gen boards

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to see sprints side by side in columns rather than a top-down list.

During the sprint planning session, it would help users to move stories between sprints rather than scrolling up and down.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to see sprints side by side in columns rather than a top-down list

fields.description:
*As a* User *I want* to see the component on the backlog board *So That* I can easily prioritize my backlog (the same way that I can see the epic)

 

I would like to see the component the same way I can see the epic to better organize my work. I know that it is possible to add the component, but the number of lines on the screen decrease for half and does not respond to my needs.

 

*As a* User *I want* to see the component on the backlog board *So That* I can easily prioritize my backlog (the same way that I can see the epic)

 

I would like to see the component the same way I can see the epic to better organize my work. I know that it is possible to add the component, but the number of lines on the screen decrease for half and does not respond to my needs.

  !image-2019-07-08-13-54-14-681.png!
fields.summary: See Component on Backlog Board

fields.description:
h2. Use case
As a scrum master running a daily stand-up meeting, I want the collapsed state of issues to be maintained between the board and filters so that I can have all the entire board's Done issues collapsed and, while each person in the stand-up meeting gives their report I can filter to that person and not have to re-collapse (or expand) the issues they're associated to, in order to run my stand-up meetings more efficiently.

For example:

Issue-1: Done + Collapsed
Issue-2: In Progress + Not Collapsed
Issue-3: In Progress + Not Collapsed

Apply quick filter that hides Issue-1, resulting view is:

Issue-2: In Progress + *Collapsed* <-- Should remain Not Collapsed
Issue-3: In Progress + Not Collapsed
fields.summary: Maintaining Swimlane collapse state when applying quick filters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if an issue is in a board, and viewing this issue in New Issue View, there's no *View on Board* button to direct the user to the board right away.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add *View on Board* button on the issue view.
fields.summary: Add View on Board button on New Issue View

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I would like to change the Epic color via issue view while working with Jira Software classic projects.

Right now, it is only possible to change the Epic color via Epic panel.
fields.summary: Allow users to change the Epic color via issue view.

fields.description:
Hello - 

We had a working integration with our Jira cloud instance edmunds.atlassian.net and a Jira user that we had set up a couple of years ago.  The username = autocreate and the email address was a google group alias [zapier@edmunds.com.|mailto:zapier@edmunds.com.]

The integration was working fine for a period of time but stopped working earlier this week ~Tuesday 7/2/19.  We believe it is because the password for this user is no longer work.

I contacted our internal IT team and they recommended that we contact Jira support for resolution.  Given that we have moved over to single sign-on with google authentication, they don't have the ability to reset the password for this user.  Can you please advise us on how to proceed?
fields.summary: Unable to connect account for authentication with Zapier

fields.description:
When attempting to start or edit a sprint start or end date using the date widget a space is added to the date text.

The added space is not compliant to the required format.

!image-2019-07-05-11-27-48-689.png!
fields.summary: Date widget adds a space at the end

fields.description: With the new Time Tracking field added recently to Next-Gen projects, would be great having the Time Tracking report so we can have an overview about the project/sprint going as we have in Classic Projects.
fields.summary: With the new Time Tracking field added recently, would be great having the Time Tracking report

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Swimlane toggle shortcut '-' does not expand all for Scrum board. It works fine for collapse but nut expand

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Goto board in work mode with swimlanes.
 # Hit shortcut key '-' to collapse all swimlanes. [That works.]
 # Hit shortcut key '-' again to expand all swimlanes.

h3. Expected Results

All swimlanes should be expanded since '-' shortcut is a toggle, per shortcut help (via shortcut key '?').
h3. Actual Results

Does nothing

 
h3. Workaround

Manually click each expand icon
fields.summary: Swimlane toggle shortcut '-' does not expand all for Scrum board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Gitlab mentioned on links are not working in the new Jira issue view. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup an integration with Gitlab according to [Gitlab's doc|https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/integrations/jira.html]
 # Specify a Jira issue on a Gitlab commit
 # Switch the old view of the referenced Jira issue and notice that the *mentioned on* link is created by the integration
# Switch to the new Jira issue view.

h3. Expected Results

The mentioned on links should be shown on the new Jira issue view. 

h3. Actual Results


The mentioned on links should is not shown on the new Jira issue view. 

h3. Workaround

Switch the old issue view of Jira.
fields.summary: Gitlab mentioned on links are not working in the new Jira issue view.

fields.description: Since now it's possible to create subtasks for a story, it would be really useful to be able to reorder them when they're listed in the parent story.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to reorder subtasks in a next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Google Chrome v75.0.3770.100 (Official Build) (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an active sprint
# Set the estimation to Original Time Estimate
# Set the time estimate of an issue in the To Do column to about 5weeks
# Set the time estimate of an issue in the  In Progress column to about 3days
# Set the time estimate of an issue in the Done column to about 2weeks 30mins

h3. Expected Results
* The gadget displays the Time estimate properly
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* The gadget does not display the Time estimate properly
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* The gadget displays properly on firefox 67.0.4 (64-bit)

h3. Workaround
Use Firefox Browser
fields.summary: The Sprint health gadget does not resize properly on Google Chrome
Accidentally starting a second sprint from a next-gen project on a classic board causes all issues from the backlog of the next-gen project to disappear

fields.description: As a Jira Software user, I would like to have the option to bulk edit issues while selecting multiple issues in a next-gen board backlog.
fields.summary: Bulk edit option while selecting multiple issues in a next-gen board backlog.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Performing JQL searches with development[] are not returning the expected results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Run the search *development[pullrequests].all > 1*, it will work. However, it only counts the PRs under the current status.

Example:
 * The issue has 2 *merged* PRs and 3 on *declined* status. The current status on the issue will be *merged*. If you search *development[pullrequests].all > 4* then no result will be returned but if you search *development[pullrequests].all > 1* then the issue will be returned.
 * The issue has 1 *merged* PRs and 1 on *open* status. The current status on the issue will be *open*. If you search *development[pullrequests].all >1* then no result will be returned but if you search *development[pullrequests].all > 0* then the issue will be returned.

h3. Expected Results
The search *development[pullrequests].all > 1* should count all PRs, independent of the current status.

h3. Actual Results
The search *development[pullrequests].all > 1* only counts the PRs under the current status.

h3. Workaround
None

h3. Additional notes
The documentation [Advanced searching - developer reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-developer-reference-967312910.html?_ga=2.186660200.1998585794.1558533096-574287046.1513609148] does not inform if that's expected behavior or not, that's why we are raising it as a bug.
In case it is expected behavior, please update the documentation and change this bug report to an improvement request.
fields.summary: Performing JQL searches with development[] are not returning the expected results.

fields.description:
Currently, the Velocity Chart report shows committed activities versus completed activities regardless of the completed activities were planned for the sprint or not, instead of reporting how much of the committed activities were successfully completed.

This method of measuring team velocity may lead to aberrant behavior in which the team scrambles to add activities to the sprint to make up to the number of hours required to execute the plan of record.

It would be better if the report could distinguish the completed issues originally added to the sprint and issues added after the sprint be started.
fields.summary: Velocity Chart improvement

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sprint related reports do not show Story Points when information is added during the issue creation. This affects Burndown Chart, Sprint Report, and Velocity Report.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Sprint
 # Create 2 issues
 ** Issue #1: Create the issue and add the Story Points later (eg 1 story point)
 ** Issue #2: Create the issue including the Story Points value during the creation (eg 5 story points)
 # Add the 2 created and estimated issues in the Sprint
 # Start the Sprint.
 # Check the reports. The correct Story Points values for each issue are in the report.
 # Complete the sprint and check the reports. The correct Story Points values for each issue are in the report.
 # Update the story points
 ** Issue #1: Change from 1 story point to 10 story points
 ** Issue #2: Change from 5 story points to 50 story points
 # Check the reports. The story points of Issue #1 is "1" and Issue #2 is "-".

The video reproducing the behavior can be found [in this URL|https://share.getcloudapp.com/8LumKgel]
h3. Expected Results

In the reports, all issues should have the story points recorded as at the time of the sprint closing. 

In the scenario above, issue #1 is correct, but issue #2 should have 5 story points.
h3. Actual Results

Only the issue that had the Story Points value added *AFTER* the creation will display the estimation.

Sprint: !Image 2019-07-01 at 5.25.56 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 Burndown: !Image 2019-07-01 at 5.26.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 Velocity: !Image 2019-07-01 at 5.26.06 PM.png|thumbnail! 
  
h3. Workaround

Estimate the issues after they are created.
fields.summary: Sprint related reports do not show Story Points when information is added during the issue creation
Allow the customization of the Description Area on Next-gen
Agile rest API for epic is not returning accurate results for the status

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian update as of 12th October 2020}
Hello everyone!
 
We’ve now rolled out the ability to hide done epics on your roadmap in both Classic and Next-gen projects! 🎉
 
You can find the documentation on how to use this feature here:
 * [Classic projects|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/customize-your-view-on-the-roadmap/]
 * [Next-gen projects|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/enable-the-roadmap/#Customize-your-view]

 
As always, we’re eager to hear about how you’re using these new features, so please let us know how you go.
 
Thanks so much,
Pete Morris
Atlassian Product Manager{panel}
 
h3. Problem Description

_Done Epics_ in Roadmap are always being shown. As a user, I'd like to hide those Done Epics after 14 days of inactivity automatically and can still be found by searching for them (just like Next-gen boards)
h3. Suggested Resolution

Hide Done Epics in Roadmap after 14 days of inactivity
fields.summary: Hide Done Epics in Roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Development panel is missing when using the new issue view
h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud + Github integration
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue that has commits using the new issue view
 ## Just a few issues are impacted

h3. Expected Results
Development panel is displayed on both issue views.
 
h3. Actual Results
Commits, branchs and pull requests are missing on issues when using the new issue view.
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 8.53.57 AM.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-06-28 at 8.53.48 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Disable the new issue view while the bug fix is not released:
* Click on profile picture
* Choose _Project settings_
* Disable the _New Jira issue view_
fields.summary: Development panel is missing when using the new issue view

fields.description:
When somebody changes Jira description field, there is no easy way to find out. It is difficult / not feasible to inspect by clicking "All" link under "Activity" each time. Instead, if anything changed in description, then a small text saying when it was update last would be idle and helpful.

Otherwise, developers would not know description changed and keep working on with original text. When it comes to testing, these updates may be surprise to all parties.
fields.summary: Unable to recognize jira description updated

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Jira issue navigator, the Sprints shown in the Sprint column are displayed randomly
 * ABC-1 Sprint 2, Sprint 3, Sprint 1
 * ABC-2 Sprint 1, Sprint 2
 * ABC-3 Sprint 1, Sprint 2, Sprint 3

h3. Suggested Solution

ensure the sprint displayed have a sequence e.g. the Sprint ID or Completed Date
fields.summary: Sprint column does not have a display sequence

fields.description:
In classic Jira projects, holding command & clicking on the issue key on a card on a Jira board opens the issue in a new tab. 

Command clicking while hovering on the key on a next-gen board selects the card. It would be nice to have this on next-gen boards as well.
fields.summary: Command + Click on Issue Key to Open issue in new tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you wish to include issues from a Next-Gen in a Classic Scrum board filter the issues from the Next-Gen project which are part of an Epic in that Next-Gen project will not display in the backlog view.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-Gen project.
 # Create an Epic in the Next-Gen project.
 # Create some stories under this Epic.
 # Create a classic Scrum project.
 # Create a filter which picks up issues from both your Classic and Next-Gen projects.
 # Create custom board using this filter. 

h3. Expected Results
All issues appear in the backlog view of the classic board.

h3. Actual Results
Issues part of the Epic in the Next-Gen project do not appear in the backlog view of your new classic board.

h3. Notes
Issues that are part of an Epic in the Next-Gen project that a part of an active sprint will still appear in the respective columns in the main board view. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issues from a Next-Gen project which are part of an Epic do not appear in a classic backlog when included in the filter for a classic board

fields.description:
when i add a comment or such to a story, there is always one typo in it that i spot whilst clicking to submit button. i'll immediately fix the typo within a second, yet my comment is marked with the red 'edited' tag now :(

could it be possible to *not* have this 'edited' tag added if nobody had requested the comment yet ? so that would get me (in most cases) enough time to do those 'first minute' edits.

maybe another tag, or such, is needed to to indicate that the comment has 'not been read' / 'is still open for editing', or such, to get the user a clue about the new behavior of the 'edited' tag...
fields.summary: no 'edited' tag when content has not been read yet

fields.description: As a user, I want to set templates to be used when creating new Next-Gen projects
fields.summary: As a user, I want to set templates to be used when creating new Next-Gen projects

fields.description: System, Portfolio and Agile fields are locked for a good reason, but as a user, I'm still able to add them to screens and workflow validators, but I'd like to make them required as it is confusing for users to have a workflow validator that isn't required in a screen :)
fields.summary: Allow Portfolio and Agile fields to be made required without unlocking them

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Recently next-gen projects have enabled subtasks as an issue type available for use. While you can now create subtasks, there is no mechanism within Next-gen to convert subtasks into Stories  NOR is there a way to convert existing stories / tasks into a subtask issue type.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would help to have the option to 
* Convert To Subtask
and
* Convert subtask to Story (or other standard issue type)

h3. Why this is important
The inability to convert such issue types makes it really tedious to recreate issues.  Sometimes a subtask becomes more complex of an issue and in turn is deserving to be it's own issue outside the bounds of that parent Story.  
In next gen you have to recreate the entire issue as a type of story, whereas in Classic projects, you can just use the convert option in the ... or More menu in order change this issue type without having to create the issue.
fields.summary: In next gen projects I want the ability to convert standard issue types into subtasks for existing issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to move a subtask of a next-gen project leads the customer to a 500 error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a subtask to an issue of next-gen project
 # Use the "Move" option from the three dots on the top right corner.
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-25 at 4.59.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

The user gets the option of moving the issue to the required project and issue type.
h3. Actual Results

500 internal server error is thrown
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-25 at 5.05.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using "Move" option on sub-task of a next-gen projects returns 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing an image in the Jira new issue view, the currently selected zoom level resets to its default when another user updates the issue.
h3. Environment

A Jira project with the new issue view enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an image in an issue and use the zoom functions

 # Have another user open the issue and make a change to it.

 # The first user's zoom level on the opened image will be reset to the original value.

h3. Expected Results

The zoom level should not be reset when the issue refreshes.
h3. Actual Results

The zoom level is reset when the issue refreshes.
h3. Workaround

Disabling the new issue view in the user profile settings or clicking the "See the old view" button in the issue details view, and viewing the image in the old issue view can be used to mitigate this behaviour.
fields.summary: Zoom level when viewing an image resets when issue is updated by another user

fields.description: Project names may change after some time and other needs may demand users to change the sprints' names after they are marked as complete, so as a Project Manager in Jira, I want to be able to rename completed sprints.
fields.summary: As a Project Manager in Jira, I want to be able to rename completed sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Exporting to image the Roadmap it renders the date with -1 year

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Next-Gen project
# Enable Roadmaps
# Add Epics
# Add Start and Due dates
# Select to export to image
# Don't change any settings, just save.
# The dates at the columns will display the correct Month but -1 year.

h3. Expected Results
It should export with the columns with the current year.

h3. Actual Results
The dates at the columns will display the correct Month but -1 year.

h3. Workaround
Changing any option when exporting will make the column remove the year information, only the month will be displayed.
fields.summary: Exporting to image the Roadmap render the date with -1 year

fields.description:
h3. Description
It's uncomfortable to have former users avatar showing up on the user's avatar list on the board. This feature would be necessary since some former employees may have been let go from the company, and current employees get uncomfortable seeing their pictures. 

h3. Behavior
Even though the user is excluded on the board's filter as an assignee, they will show up if they are assigned to a sub-task, for example. 

h3. Workaround
Assign the issue to another user.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to remove former users avatars from the board's user avatar list

fields.description:
h3. Description
searching by "abc[" at the quick filter search box breaks the page causing no other filter to work

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Open the backlog
# At the search box, type anything like *abc[*
# The URL will be updated with the search
# Clearing the search results will not clear the URL
# Its affects other quick filters that stop to work

See the video reproducing: https://cl.ly/8a5eb3214f23

h3. Expected
Clearing the results should clear the search from the URL and the page should allow using other quick filters

h3. Actual results
The URL breaks the page and no other quick filter works.
It also breaks the ability to open the issues in the pop-up view.

h3. Workaround
Reload the entire page by clicking at the Backlog or remove the search condition from the URL
fields.summary: searching by "abc[" at the quick filter search box breaks the page causing no other filter to work

fields.description:
h3. There was always, a space provided to drop an issue in the backlog when it is moved up and down. However, this only works in Chrome but not in Firefox or Safari.

There isn't any indicator as shown below in Firefox/Safari
* !Indicator.jpg|thumbnail!

In Chrome, there's a space to drop the issue as shown below:
* !indicator in Chrome.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
 * Affects Mozilla Firefox & Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Backlog using Firefox/Safari
 # Try to drag issue and drop

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Indicator to Drag and drop issue in backlog is missing

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
Triggering Build & Release from JIRA using Firefox will receive the error:
"An error occurred while trying to retrieve build information"

h3. *Steps to replicate*
 # Setup Bamboo and integrate to a Cloud Instance
 # Trigger a version's "Build & Release" from JIRA using Firefox

h3. *Expected Result*
Able to Build and Release through Jira

h3. *Actual Result*
"An error occurred while trying to retrieve build confirmation" appear when releasing a version using Firefox

h3. *Workaround*
Use Chrome for now
{panel}
fields.summary: Triggering Build & Release from JIRA using Firefox will receive the error: "An error occurred while trying to retrieve build information"

fields.description:
It would be nice to have this feature so I can see the velocity dependent on the Epic.

I think this feature existed in the classic version.
fields.summary: Velocity Report Filtered by Epics

fields.description:
h3. Summary

At this current point in time it is not possible to set a team-managed (formerly next-gen) *access* property (the one you can set in *Project Settings > Details*) via REST API, neither when creating the project nor afterwards.
h3. Workaround

There is an internal endpoint that you can currently use to change the project access setting but this is not documented, not supported and it can change without prior notice: */rest/internal/simplified/1.0/projects/PROJECT-ID/summary*

In order to change the access settings you have to sent a PUT request to the */rest/internal/simplified/1.0/projects/PROJECT-ID/summary* specifying: 
 *accessLevel*: "OPEN", "PRIVATE" or "LIMITED"
 *avatarId*: avatar id of the project
 *key*: project key
 *name*: project name

 

Example:
 # Call [https://XXXXX.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project|https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project] endpoint to get project info:
{noformat}
// https://xxxxxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project

  {
    "expand": "description,lead,issueTypes,url,projectKeys,permissions",
    "self": "https://xxxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/10303",
    "id": "10303",
    "key": "TSMN",
    "name": "Test Scrum Migration NextGen",
.....
{noformat}
# change the access settings to the above project by sending a PUT request to [https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/internal/simplified/1.0/projects/10303/summary:]
{noformat}
curl -u EMAIL:API-TOKEN -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"key": "TSMN", "name": "Test Scrum Migration NextGen", "avatarId": 10722, "accessLevel": "PRIVATE"}' -X PUT https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/rest/internal/simplified/1.0/projects/10303/summary

{"returnUrl":"/browse/TSMN","id":10303,"key":"TSMN","name":"Test Scrum Migration NextGen","accessLevel":{"value":"PRIVATE","displayName":"Private","description":"Only people added to the project can create and edit issues. Issues in this project don't appear in search results.","iconName":"private"},"avatarId":10201}
{noformat}
fields.summary: It should be possible to set team-managed (formerly next-gen) project access (open, private or limited) via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When opening a board from a classic project, the name of the board is not being displayed on the tab title.

h3. Environment
Classic projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic project (Scrum or Kanban);
 # Go to the project's board;

h3. Expected Results
Title on the tab should be "<Board Name> - Jira"
h3. Actual Results
Title on the tab is "Agile Board - JIRA"

 !Screen Shot 2019-06-20 at 14.43.16.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Browser tab titles no longer display project board name

fields.description:
I observed on Issue Detail page that System does not display comment until refresh the page when update bug status.

Steps:

1. Updated issue from Resolved to Reopened.

Result: It displayed Reopen Issue popup.

2. Added comment and clicked on Reopen Issue button.

Bug: Activity>> Comments section did not display added comments until refresh the page.

Note: It displays comments when refresh the page.
fields.summary: Issue: System does not display comment until refresh the page when update bug status

fields.description:
I observed that Status Issue pop up does not have an option to attached screenshot.

Steps:
 # Created issue type "Bug".
 # Update status from Resolved to Reopened.
 # Result: It displayed Reopen Issue popup.
 # Observation: Pop up did not have an option to attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Issues: Status Issue pop up does not have an option to attached screenshot

fields.description:
Is not possible to set a default value for the description field in next-gen projects.
This functionality is important for templates for specific issue types like a bug for for example.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to set the default value for the description field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to transition an issue from one status to another, if a board has a rule to update a dropdown custom field for a specific issue type, if the issue type being transitioning doesn't have that custom field, it won't work and a message error is thrown informing an error about rank.
h3. Environment
 * Next-gen projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dropdown custom field for one specific issue type;
 # Create a rule to update this custom field on the board;
 # Try transitioning a different issue type from which the custom field belongs to;

h3. Expected Results

The issue will be transitioned, and the rule will skip issue types that don't have that specific issue type.
h3. Actual Results

The issue won't be transitioned.
 Error message on the UI when transitioning the issue on the board:
||The ranking of your issue has failed.||
|We were unable to rank your issue. Please try again later|

Error message on the UI when transitioning the issue using the status dropdown:
||Transition failed||
|Unable to update custom field customfield_<CUSTOM_FIELD_REFERENCE> - <CUSTOM_FIELD_NAME> in issue [<ISSUE_KEY>].|
h3. Notes

This seems to be occurring only for the dropdown custom fields.
h3. Workaround

Adding the same custom field for all issue types.
fields.summary: Rule to update a dropdown custom field for a specific issue type doesn’t skip other issues types that don’t have that particular custom field

fields.description:
h3. Description
Dots in Kanban cards considering weekends even when they are not selected on ‘Working Days’
It would be interesting to have the dots in Kanban boards reflecting the configuration set on ‘Working Days’ settings.
Currently, even if users uncheck Saturday and Sunday on their boards, the amount of dots displayed on the cards disregards this setting and the total days in a column will consider a 7 days week.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a board
# Create issues
# Enable Days in Column information at Board Settings
# It counts non-working days for the days in columns

h3. Expected Results
Only working days should be counted

h3. Actual Results
It counts non-working days for the days in columns

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround as this value is automatically calculated.
fields.summary: Days in column indicator dots should respect non-working days for the board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The due date is showing as -1 day at the label on Next-Gen issue cards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add due date field to the issue type on your Next-Gen project
# Set a due date
# The label will display -1 day from the value on the field

h3. Expected Results
The due date of the field should be presented as previously configured.

h3. Actual Results
The date is presented as - 1 day of the data configured.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there's no workaround.
fields.summary: The due date is showing as -1 day at the label on Next-Gen issue cards

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*

UI inconsistency between Next-Gen's:
 - "add to *issue parent*" from the backlog and
 !Screenshot 2019-06-19 at 9.37.45 AM.png|thumbnail!
 - "add to *parent issue*" when opening the issue from the side.
 !Screenshot 2019-06-19 at 9.35.52 AM.png|thumbnail!

*Suggestion*
 amend the consistency for add-to-epic function in Next-gen board
fields.summary: UI inconsistency between Next-Gen "add to parent issue" and "add to issue parent"

fields.description: Previously, there was an "Edit" button in the ellipses menu of a sub-task on a parent issue view. This was recently removed. In order to update the estimates on a sub-task, we now need to click "View Issue" and open the subtask and edit the fields from there. This adds time to our Sprint Planning and Grooming process and requires switching back and forth between multiple pages. It would be very helpful to have the edit button back and have the sub-task edit modal appear.
fields.summary: Add "Edit" button back to sub-task menu on parent issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Applying a quick filter at the backlog changes the count of issues on backlog section

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a backlog on Agile board (Scrum or Kanban)
 # Apply a quick filter like (Assigned to me)

https://cl.ly/0598049a494d

h3. Expected Results
It should return at least the number of issues that are returned by the filter

h3. Actual Results
It renders the quick filter but the number of items on backlog changes to a higher number

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Applying a quick filter at the backlog changes the count of issues on backlog section

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

 
||What||How||Consequences||
|Issues mistakenly added to the sprint| # Customer has sprints on different boards with similar name
 # When a user opens an issue on edit mode and clicks on dropdown then all sprints will be listed
 # User chooses the wrong sprint (dropdown doesn't have reference to its board)|The board A will display a sprint that was created on board B.
If the user doesn't have access on all projects returned by the other board B then he won't be able to start and complete that sprint on board A.|
|Issues mistakenly added to the sprint| # Customer has sprints on different boards with reference to the project name
 # User mistakenly add the issue on a sprint that belongs to another board|The board A will display a sprint that was created on board B. # The user doesn't want the sprint on board A and delete it
 ## The team on board B will lose their work.
 # The user assigns more issues to the sprint and start/complete the sprint
 ## The team on board B will have their sprint started without knowing why that happened. Their remaining work will be moved to backlog.
 # The user renames the sprint on board A to match the project name
 ## The team on board B will be confused about the change|
|Issues mistakenly added to the sprint| # Customer has sprints on different boards with reference to the project name
 # User mistakenly add the issue on a sprint that belongs to another board
 # User closes the issue|The board A won't display the sprint that was created on board B.
If the user creates a new sprint on board A then it will follow the name pattern for sprints on board B and he won't understand how it happened.|
|The team board has different projects in order to verify the individuals backlog| # The team A  works on project A however its developers are also working on project B. The manager for team A needs to have a clear view of the developers time allocation on board A and so he uses the filter *Project = A or assignee in (User1, User2)*|If the board's A the next sprint is from board B, the users won't be able to start the sprint from project A.|
|The team board has different projects in order to verify the individuals backlog| # The team A  works on project A however its developers are also working on project B. The manager for team A needs to have a clear view of the developers time allocation on board A and so he uses the filter *Project = A or assignee in (User1, User2)*
 # User closes the sprint on board A|If there are open issues then the pop up to close the sprint will suggest moving the issues to the next sprint which might belong to project B|

 
 
h3. Suggested Solution

Enable the option to restrict the scope of sprint to projects (or boards)
fields.summary: Restrict the scope of an sprint to specific projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users who use Firefox to load boards in Jira is facing slowness as compared to using Google Chrome.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Access the boards page using Firefox. 
- Open a Software Board

h3. Expected Results

- The board loads similar to the load time in Chrome.

h3. Actual Results

- There is a spinning wheel when loading the board and the load time is slower compared to Chrome.


h3. Workaround

Use Google Chrome
fields.summary: Loading boards in Firefox is slower compared to Chrome

fields.description:
When creating new Issues in the Backlog/Development Panel, I type a summary in the 'What needs to be done?' dialog box and hit enter.  After that, a window pops up to create a new Issue with an error message at the top that says:

'Unfortunately, there is an internal communication error, so you must use the full dialog to create the issue. Please contact your administrator if this error keeps appearing.'

I fill out the summary to create the same Issue, but the original Issue is still generated, leaving me with 2 Issues with the same title.
fields.summary: Error when creating an Issue in the Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
[Deployment searches|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/viewing-the-release-information-for-an-issue-961266839.html] doesn't work for Bamboo integration.

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable deployment JQL for Bamboo integration
fields.summary: Enable deployment JQL for Bamboo integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Epic badges won't be rendered for all epics if a board has more than 100 of them.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board with more than 100 epics
 # Associate issues to these epics
 # Load the backlog
 # Not all epics will be shown as badges
 # (which epics are shown depends on their summary and keys)

h3. Expected Results

All epics are correctly rendered
h3. Actual Results

Not all epics are correctly rendered
h3. Workaround

Prefix the summaries of the epics you want to see with a low sorting order character, like a number.
fields.summary: Having more than 100 epics on a board won't always render their badges in the backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The next-gen "Group by" feature is not displaying the swimlanes in the issues' order.

If you compare the order of the issues in the backlog view and in the Active sprint view when the "Group by" option is defined by Sub-task, Epic or Assignee, the order of the swimlanes don't follow the pattern of the backlog view (Rank)
h3. Environment

Jira Software cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Scrum next-gen project
 # Add stories to it and sub-tasks to some of the stories, or add Epics to the roadmap and Stories under it
 # Access the *Board view* (active sprint view) and in the *Group by* options menu select *Subtask* or *Epics*
 # Compare the order of the issues in the active sprint view with the backlog view

h3. Expected Results

The order of the issues should be the same in both views
h3. Actual Results

The order of the issues is different:

!Screen Shot 2019-06-14 at 7.25.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-14 at 7.26.06 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Create a Classic board and edit its filter to return the next-gen issues.
fields.summary: The next-gen "Group by" feature is not displaying the swimlanes in the issues' order

fields.description:
Currently, when a user clicks a board card, this user sees the board's issue detail view with some fields visible, but to access the full issue view it's necessary to open the board's issue view and then click the issue key to be redirected to the full issue view.

As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to access the full issue view directly from the board's cards, for example by clicking with the left mouse button in the card.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to access the full issue view directly from the board's cards

fields.description:
Hello

I have been playing around with permission schemes to lock down our projects.

I have a requirement where I need to give members of my team access to the release tab for a given software project.  They are responsible for creating releases and what goes on when.  The issue is in order to achieve this I need to set on my permission scheme the permission of "Administer Projects" to my developers. 

When I assign this permission to my developers they can access the release tab which is great.  But this has given them access to other areas which I would prefer they didn't have access to.  For example, they can access the board settings.  We have a custom workflow plugged into our boards and a developer of mine went in and removed a status from a column which made a load of issues "disappear" from the board.

 

I feel the "Administer Projects" permission needs to be broken down so we can decide what parts of the projects are accessible to the developers.

Can this be achieved at all?

We are currently using JIRA Cloud.
fields.summary: More Granular Permissions

fields.description:
It would be great if the sprint report could also show all completed issues inside the sprint date range, and not only completed issues that were part of this sprint.

All completed issues (based on the board filter) between the sprint start and completed date.
fields.summary: Sprint report - Show all completed issues between the sprint start and completion date.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [Manage epics in next-gen projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/manage-epics-in-next-gen-projects-960142560.html] documentation page is referring to options that are named differently and this is causing confusion.

Specifically:
 - The steps and screenshots provided to add or remove/modify issues from epics are saying you should use the options *Add to Epic* or *Change Epic* (respectively):
 !Add+to+epic+(Backlog).png|thumbnail! !Add+to+epic+(Board).png|thumbnail! !Unassign+epic.png|thumbnail!

 
 - The above options do not actually exist and you have to use *Add to parent issue* and *Change parent issue* instead:
 !add-to-parent-issue1.jpg|thumbnail! !add-to-parent-issue2.jpg|thumbnail! !change-parent-issue.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround.

Use *Add to parent issue* and *Change parent issue* in order to add or change/remove an issue from an epic.
fields.summary: Please fix the 'Manage epics in next-gen projects' documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Stories have sub-task label and can't be ranked on Kanban boards when moved from next-gen

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Epic and a Story on a Next-gen board
 # Add the Story to the Epic
 # Move the Story to a Classic project with Kanban board
 # Open the Kanban board  and the Story will be missing displayed as sub-task
 # Try ranking the story and nothing will happen


h3. Expected Results
Story is considered a standard issue

h3. Actual Results
The board handles the Story as a sub-task

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Stories have sub-task label and can't be ranked on Kanban boards when moved from next-gen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Velocity Report on Next-Gen does not render the name of the seventh sprint
This leads to believe that it is the current active sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have 7 sprints completed on the Next-Gen and start the eighth one.
# Access the Velocity Report
# It does not render the name of the last completed sprint.

h3. Expected Results
It should display all the sprint names

h3. Actual Results
It displays only 6 of 7 sprint names

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Velocity Report on Next-Gen does not render the name of the seventh sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the board is not using the ranking system (the board's filter query ending with "order by rank"), the update in the card is delayed until the next update, which can cause confusion among users. The following video better illustrates this:

 [^JSWCLOUD-17941.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access a software board which is not using the ranking system;
# Make sure something in the card will change when you drag and drop a card among columns (for example, having the "status" field as one of the three card fields);
# Drag and drop the card among columns

h3. Expected Results

* The card information will update as soon as it is placed in a new column.

h3. Actual Results

* The card information will not be updated. Drag and dropping the card again to another column, the information will display the updates that were supposed to appears in the first move.

h3. Workaround

Hard refresh the page.
fields.summary: If the board is not using rank, the card update in the board is delayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After migrating a Scrum project from Classic to Next-Gen I cannot bulk update epic links: in the bulk update screen I get 3 entries for the epic link field and none of them shows anything but a "no matches" in the drop-down menu:
 !Cannot-change-epic-link.jpg|thumbnail! 


Everything works fine when editing an issue at the time instead:
 !Can-change-epic-link-one-at-the-time.jpg|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate a Scrum project from classic to next-gen by following the steps in: [Migrate between next-gen and classic projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-between-next-gen-and-classic-projects-957974933.html]
 # Run a search, select some issues, click on the  3 dots on the upper right corner and select "bulk change all xxx issues", choose "edit issues". (full instructions in: [Editing multiple issues at the same time|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/editing-multiple-issues-at-the-same-time-902498099.html])
 # Scroll down to  "Change Epic Link"

h3. Expected Results
There  is one entry to change the Epic link and in there you can select the desired Epic from the drop-down menu

h3. Actual Results
There are multiple entries to change the Epic link and in the drop-down menu there a "No Matches" is displayed
 !Cannot-change-epic-link.jpg|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
If you want to edit the Epic link for open issues you can use multi-select on the board or the backlog to bulk assign Stories to Epics;
 !Add-epic-from-backlog.png|thumbnail! 

\\
If you want to update issues that are already in "Done" status instead, you can then use the below workaround. However please keep in mind that it is using an internal endpoint not officially documented/supported and this workaround might stop working without prior notice:

Send a POST  request to the REST API endpoint https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/internal/simplified/1.0/projects/PROJECT-ID/issues/EPIC-ID/children providing a list of issue-ids in the request body.

Example:
- IDs of the issues to be updated: 10405, 10203
- Project ID: 10303
- Epic ID: 10519
- Curl command to set the Epic (10519) as a parent to the desired issues (10405 ,10203). Please replace all the things in CAPITAL with the proper values:
{noformat}
curl -D- -u EMAIL:API_TOKEN -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{ "issueIds" : ["ISSUE-ID-1", "ISSUE-ID-2"] }' -X POST https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/internal/simplified/1.0/projects/PROJECT-ID/issues/EPIC-ID/children
{noformat}

In order to get the list of issue-id to update you can:
# Run a search to get the list of issues to update
# Switch to the list view
# Select to display only the issue-key column and export to CSV current columns only. This way you get a CSV file that only contains issue-key and issue-id. You can parse this file in many different ways to just  get a coma separated list of issue-ids surrounded by double quotes

For details on how to authenticate REST API calls using API TOKENS please refer to the  [API tokens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/api-tokens-938839638.html] documentation page.
fields.summary: After migrating from Classic to Next-Gen it's not possible to bulk edit epic links

fields.description:
As a JIRA User, I want an ability to go top of page on a ticket with one click of a button when reviewing the comments go long scroll down.
something like below.
!image-2019-06-13-16-39-16-900.png!
fields.summary: As a JIRA User, I want an ability to go top of page on a ticket with one click of a button when reviewing the comments go long scroll down.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the *Quick filters* bar, the displayed Assignee avatar is limited to 6 users and is not adjustable.

For larger screen sizes, this creates a large blank and unused space to which more avatar could be displayed.

 !KANBAN_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

Make the total number of Assignees displayed adjust automatically according to the screen/window size and increase the limit beyond 6 users.
fields.summary: Increase Assignees displayed on Quick filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a customer, when adding Jira Service Desk issues in Software projects, I would like to be able to use the *Create Linked Issues* directly from the board.

h3. Expected Results

Pop-up the window to create a linked issue.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens and the page just refreshes.
fields.summary: Allow to use the Create Linked Issue to be used in Jira Software projects

fields.description:
When users go to other screens of a project (Reports, for example) and use the board dropdown to switch boards, they are redirected to the board view instead of staying in the Report view.

As a Jira Software user, I want to stay in the selected view when I switch from one board to another using the dropdown in the left menu.
fields.summary: On board switch option list the select view should be preserved

fields.description:
h3. Description
When you move an issue between two projects, the issue key changes following the order of the new project and keeps the smart commit reference from the old project. However, if you deleted the old project and update the project key to be the key from the deleted project and the order of the new project reaches the issue number from the old project, the smart commit will also be linked with the new issue.

This causes confusion because will end in issues having smart commits synced with issues that are not related to that commit, causing issues being processed if it has comments or triggers to move issues.

h3. Reproducing
# Create a project A and add a few issues
# At the issue 5, add a smart commit
# Move the issue A-5 to a new project B with no issues
# The issue will be B-1 and will keep the smart commit from A-5
# Delete the project A and update the project key to use the key from the deleted project (B -> A)
# Create new issues in project B till it reaches the number 5
# The smart commit from the migrated issue will be synced with issue 5 created at the project B

h3. Expected
The commit should be synced with only the original issue

h3. Actual result
The commit is synced between two issues, the one that was migrated from A to B, and the new issue that was created on project B that had the pkey updated to A and reached the issue number from the reference of the migrated issue.

h3. Workaround
Update all the commits at the Git repository to avoid the sync between the issues.
fields.summary: Moving an issue with smart commits from project A to B, deleting project A, updating project B key to A causes the smart commits from deleted project be synced between two issues

fields.description:
In many implementations, Kanban uses a pull methodology. In classic projects, we can either have 2 statuses per column where one is the “Ready for ...” status, or we can use a drop down field to designate “Ready to pull”.

It would be helpful if we could do one of the following In Next-Gen boards:
 # Add checkbox attributes to next-gen cards (or add any fields)
 # Add a special field, similar to Rally (see the green checkbox): [https://docs.ca.com/sites/default/files/multimedia/CustomBoard_main.png].

 
{panel:title=Note|bgColor=lightYellow}
It may be worth pointing out that cards can also be _blocked_ in Rally. While we certainly enjoy using Jira more than other systems, a client of ours previously had Rally and this was a great feature to have.
{panel}
fields.summary: Next-Gen “Ready to Pull”

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using bulk operation to move issues as a subtask of another issue in a next-gen project fails.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for issues of a next-gen project.
 # Use bulk change option to update a few issues as a subtask of another issue within the same project

h3. Expected Results

The issues type and parent issue fields get updated of the selected issues.
h3. Actual Results

The below error occurs.
{noformat}
Error while performing bulk operation on issues. Please refer to Jira logs for more details.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Using bulk operation to move issues to subtask of another issue fails for next-gen projects

fields.description:
On a next-gen project we only have 3 roles available - member, viewer, administrator, with pre-defined permissions. 

We like everyone to be able to manage watchers so we would like to be able to modify the member role permissions, but this is not possible.

Please add the ability to modify the permissions of the default roles and/or create custom roles for next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Ability to modify next-gen project roles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a Next-Gen Scrum software project has multiple epics with issues associated to them the Sprint health gadget will only report on issues not associated to an Epic. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-Gen Scrum project.
 # Create multiple Epics.
 # Create several issues with story point estimates and associate some to the Epics and leave some without a parent issue.
 # Add these to a sprint and start the sprint.
 # Create a dashboard.
 # Add the Sprint health gadget to the dashboard and select the current sprint from your Next-Gen project to report on.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should report on all issues regardless of being a child of an epic or not. 
h3. Actual Results
the gadget will only report on issues that are not part of an Epic.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sprint health gadget not displaying correct data for next-gen projects containing multiple Epics

fields.description:
We need a consolidated pie chart for all projects. At present if we create filter and use it in gadget. It gives separate status for each project even though the names are same.

So need a consolidate pie chart which can map same status name.
fields.summary: Consolidated Pie Chart for all projects

fields.description:
As a Jira Software project administrator, I want to be able to see and manage sprints in the Roadmap feature.

This can help users to have a planning view of sprints in the same way it can be done currently with Epics.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software project administrator, I want to be able to see and manage sprints in the Roadmap feature

fields.description: As a Jira Software project admin, I want the ability to relate Themes to JIRA issues so users can see how much effort they are investing in particular initiatives.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software project admin, I want to be able to add themes to Next-Gen Projects

fields.description: When entering a description or comment, the text often gets into some paragraph mode that adds extra spaces and it is impossible to change.  The "Style" options often do not work and certainly do not apply as expected.  We often use a copy/paste to enter technical steps to reproduce an issue.  We always have to use a "paste as plain text" in order to be able to control how it looks.    This is a critical but very weak part of your system.
fields.summary: Text Editor for descriptions and comments is very difficult to use

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when the number of issues exceeded the limit set in the Column Constraint, the column just changes color.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option for users to choose to be notified when the number of issues exceeded the limit set in the Column Constraint.
fields.summary: Notify user when Issue Count exceeded the Column Constraint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL Autocomplete is not working for "Epic Name" and "Epic Color" fields on swimlanes' configuration
h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic project
 # Add some stories and Epics to it
 # On the board's view, at the top-right of the screen, click *more(...) > Board settings > Swimlanes*
 # On the menu *Base Swimlanes on* select *Queries*
 # In the *JQL* field, type the following

{code:java}
"Epic Name" = "{code}
h3. Expected Results

Some epic names are proposed to autocomplete the value
h3. Actual Results

No epic names are proposed

!Screen Recording 2019-06-04 at 08.04 PM.gif|width=861,height=424!
h3. Notes

It affects only the fields "Epic Name" and "Epic Color"
h3. Workaround

Type the whole epic name or epic color in the search
fields.summary: JQL Autocomplete is not working for "Epic Name" and "Epic Color" fields on swimlanes' configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a classic board, adding a status or a column with status will fail if the filter is based on Next-gen project
h3. Environment
 * Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-gen project
 # Create a filter for the project
 # Create a classic board with the filter
 # Try editing the adding a new status/column to the board
 ** You must be an administrator on the project

h3. Expected Results

The option to add a status is disabled on the board, only columns should be available.
h3. Actual Results

{{Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (WORKFLOW). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'}}
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

To add a status, try the Next-gen board.
To add a column to the board, try impersonating a user who doesn't have admin rights on project.
fields.summary: On a classic board, adding a status or a column with status will fail if the filter is based on Next-gen project

fields.description: In line with the announcement of a native application for Jira Cloud on macOS, a Windows native application would be great to see.
fields.summary: Native Windows application for Jira cloud

fields.description:
At the moment, the Sprint reporting is still limited for Team-Managed projects.

It would be beneficial to have an *Epic Report* available that correlates in progress epics with the sprint information. The data would be useful for reporting to stakeholders who are mostly interested on the epic level and not the specific Jira issues.
fields.summary: Provide an epic report in Team-Managed scrum project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Statuses in the *To do* and *In progress* category can be mapped to the Done column on the far right in the Board configuration.

This means that Issues that do not have a *Done* status can be seen as completed and archived by the Board.

This is not togglable and users do not have the option of keeping these Issues visible on the Board as they will be hidden when completing Sprints or Releasing a Version.

h3. Proposed solution

Provide an option to toggle the visibility of incompleted statuses mapped to the Done column.
fields.summary: Toggle visibility of completed Issues in the Done column

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of October 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this ticket.

As this ticket is a duplicate of JSWCLOUD-17371, we are closing this ticket so that we can aggregate the feedback on a single ticket.

Cheers,
Emily Chan
Product Manager, Atlassian.
{panel}
h3. Problem Statement

NextGen project isn't visible when selecting the option "creating Board from an existing project"
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Create a board
 # Select "Board from an existing project
 !Screenshot 2019-06-04 at 12.52.28 PM.png!
 # Select the "Project" option menu
 !Screenshot 2019-06-04 at 12.54.33 PM.png|width=480,height=213!

h3. Suggestion

Allow the option to *select NextGen project* when creating Board from an existing project
h3. Workaround

Create a saved filter containing NextGen issues and create a board using the saved filter
fields.summary: Create a Board from an existing NextGen project

fields.description: The dropdown width changes relative to the content inside. So when it's a smaller word such as "Viewer" compared to a larger piece of content such as "Multiple (2 roles)" the dropdowns are all different widths making the list look jagged and messy. As this is an Atlaskit component, I'm wondering if we can set a width no matter what content is in there? Not sure how else to solve this.
fields.summary: The 'roles' dropdown in our People page is a different size per role, making the list look jagged in order

fields.description: It would be good to be able to set the search engine properties where to search by default. Because now a days when I would like to search for a sepecific fielsd what I have created before the search engine will fail to find it.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to use the basic search engine as the followings.

fields.description: It would be nice if we could configure Jira so that a notification is sent out to users when they are removed from specific project roles
fields.summary: Notification when JIRA developer access is revoked

fields.description:
As a Jira user,

I want to see the Sprint Goal in my Burnup Report or any other report,

So that I am reminded what the Sprint Goal was after the Sprint is closed.
----
It's very simple: When starting a Sprint, there is a field for the Sprint Goal. During the Sprint, this Sprint Goal is still visible on the Board.

This way, if one closes the Board, the Sprint Goal is still visible to look back on, whenever somebody wants to check up on it. 

Example I shared in a next-gen board: [IMAGE|https://tnckb94959.i.lithium.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/48529i99220AEE18120E41/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999]
fields.summary: Next-Gen: Sprint Goal in Sprint Report (Burnup)

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
There used to be an option "Add to Epic" when right clicking on an issue via the Backlog view. 

h3. Steps to replicate
 # Go to Scrum board
 # Create an issue on the board and an Epic
 # Right Click on the created issue from the board

h3. Expected Result
an option to "Add to Epic" via the options menu

h3. Suggestion
Option to "Add to Epic" via the option menu
fields.summary: include a "Add to Epic" via the option menu from the Backlog view

fields.description:
The button *Add to Epic* was replaced/renamed by *Add to parent issue*, and the button *Change Epic* was replaced/renamed by *Change parent issue*.

However, the *group by* still shows the option *Epic* while it should be *Parent issue*.
fields.summary: Next-gen board - Rename group by Epic to group by Parent issue.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud, a next-gen project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen project
 # Change its key

h3. Expected Results
The browser tab will show the new key
The sprint will be shown in the new-key board

h3. Actual Results
The browser tab's title is still the old key
The sprint appears to be located in the board named after the old project key

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing a next-gen project's key does not propagate everywhere

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

 Currently, on the column config, users will only be able to set the WIP limit. There is no functionality to see the accumulated story points for the entire column.

h3.Suggested Solution
Include the accumulated story point as well next to the WIP limit which will give better visibility to the users.
fields.summary: Include accumulated story points for each column of the board

fields.description:
Can you create a role in Jira that could be provided to project admins only and that should consider following points:
 # Update or modify workflow in his/her project as current access role does not permit this.
 # Should not be able to view any other projects or make any changes in the projects in which the user doesn't have access .
 # should not be able to delete workflow - only site admins should be able to do that.
 #  Can create, update,delete sprints and issues.
fields.summary: Access to specific people

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Stories are missing on backlog and some epics are displayed as swimlanes (if the board swimlane is set to Story)

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Epic and a Story on a Next-gen board
 # Add the Story to the Epic
 # Move both issues to a classic project with Scrum board
 # Open the Scrum board  and the Story will be missing since it's recognized as sub-task

OR

 # Create an Epic and a Story on a Next-gen board
 # Add the Story to the Epic
 # Move both issues to a classic project with Scrum board
 # Create a sprint on classic board
 # Add the issues to the sprint and start it
 # Set the board swimlane to Story
 # Open the Scrum board, go to active sprint and the Epic will be the swimlane

h3. Expected Results
Story is displayed on backlog

h3. Actual Results
Issues are missing on board and an *issue.field.issueparentassociation* log can be found in the *History* of the affected Issues.

h3. Workaround
Contact Support.
fields.summary: Stories are disappearing from the backlog (in classic) when moved from a next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to change the board filter. While clicking on the filter dropdown, inside the board configuration, an error is thrown.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field in a next-gen project
 # Create a filter and order by this custom field ID
 ** *order by cf[FIELD ID]*
 # Try changing the filter of some board and search for this filter

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown return the available filters and the user is able to choose a new filter for the board.
h3. Actual Results
When the dropdown shows the filter it displays the following error:
{code:java}
The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation{code}
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Update the filters so they can have the custom field name instead of the id.
 The list of impacted filters can be requested on [support.atlassian.com|http://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Unable to change the board filter due to filter ranking
